Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.

And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to

And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need

I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet. Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet. And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and t

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginati

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their a

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagI can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look loke.

I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken myI can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look loke.

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  TheI can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.

Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look loke.

I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert andI can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look loke.

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look loke.

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environm

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't requ

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or as much p

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or as much pr

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or as much processing, particula

They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or as mu

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other m

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other ma

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly wh

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  


Having said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  


Having said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still g

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  


Having said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still ge

They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  


Having said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get inv

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  


Having said all that, I still love to read.

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  And audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quic

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as w

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, audiobooks are the way to go.  I love to read, don't get me wrong.  But reading is way more limited than listening to an audiobook.  I can listen to a book while I am walking, driving, or doing the dishes.  I can't imagine some of the long driving trips I've taken by myself without an audiobook to listen to.  They've kept me alert and safe on those drives.  I can hear a story anytime that I don't have to be listening or concentrating on something else.  Taking long walks outside or on a treadmill, time passes more quickly when I haveAnd audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.

Taking long walks outside or on a treadmill, time passes more quickly when I have an audiobook playAnd audiobooks are great for my eyes.  My eyesight isn't what it used to be, and when I read for long periods I suffer from eyestrain.  

Audiobooks are also great for kids with learning disabilities, or that can't concentrate.  It also allows children in general to hear stories that they may not have been able to read because their reading isn't advanced enough yet.  Although we need to take care that children learn to read the words they hear at the appropriate time in their learning cycle.  Use of different voices are more engaging for a child as well, and they can still use their imaginations as they think about what the characters and their actions look like.

Another benefit of audiobooks is environmental.  They don't require use of paper or other materials, particularly when downloaded.  You can access them quickly and easily as well.

aving said all that, I still love to read.
  But when I can't read, I can still get involved in a good story, which is one of my favorite things to do.
